title: User Authentication and Family Setup
description: As a parent, I want to be able to sign up and log in to the application, and create/join a family account so that I can manage my family's schedule and tasks.
acceptance_criteria: User can sign up using email/password.
User can sign up/log in using Google Sign-In.
User can create a new family account.
User can invite another parent to join their family account via email.
Invited parent can accept the invitation and join the family account.
Multiple parent accounts can be linked to a single family account.
A primary parent account can be designated.

title: Child Profile Management
description: As a parent, I want to create and manage profiles for each of my children so that I can assign tasks and track their activities individually.
acceptance_criteria: Parent can create a profile for a child, including their name.
Parent can add an optional profile picture for a child.
Parent can specify the child's age.
Parent can edit existing child profiles.
Parent can delete child profiles.

title: Shared Family Calendar Management
description: As a parent, I want to view and manage a shared family calendar so that all family members are aware of scheduled activities and I can easily coordinate.
acceptance_criteria: A central calendar view is accessible to all linked parent users.
The calendar displays all scheduled events for the family.
Parents can add new events to the calendar.
When adding an event, parents can specify Title, Date, Start Time, End Time, Location.
Parents can assign an event to one or more specific children.
Parents can select a category for the event (pre-defined or customizable).
Parents can add free-text notes to any calendar event.
Parents can edit existing events.
Parents can delete existing events.
Changes made by one parent are reflected for all linked parents.

title: Recurring Schedule Creation
description: As a parent, I want to create recurring schedules for regular activities like classes or study sessions so that I don't have to manually add them each time.
acceptance_criteria: Users can create events that repeat on a daily basis.
Users can create events that repeat on a weekly basis.
Users can create events that repeat on a monthly basis.
For weekly recurrence, users can select specific days of the week.
Users can set an end date for recurring events.
Users can choose to have recurring events with no end date.

title: Google Calendar Integration
description: As a parent, I want the app to sync with my Google Calendar so that all my family's activities are in one place and I don't miss any events.
acceptance_criteria: Users can connect their Google Calendar account.
Events created in Parental Planner Pro are pushed to the user's Google Calendar.
Events from the user's Google Calendar (within the family context) are pulled into Parental Planner Pro.
Users can configure the direction of synchronization (two-way, one-way push, one-way pull).
Synchronization handles updates and deletions correctly.

title: Kid's Task Management and Completion
description: As a child, I want to see my assigned tasks and be able to mark them as complete so that I can track my responsibilities and earn rewards.
acceptance_criteria: Each child profile has a dedicated task list view.
Tasks assigned by parents (e.g., homework, chores) are displayed clearly with their due dates/times.
Children can mark their tasks as completed.
Parents can also mark tasks as completed on behalf of their child.
Task completion updates the parent's view.
Completed tasks are visually distinguished from pending tasks.

title: Points-Based Reward System
description: As a parent, I want to assign points to tasks and allow my children to earn rewards for completing them, so that they are motivated to be responsible.
acceptance_criteria: Parents can define specific tasks and assign a point value to each.
When a task is marked as complete, the assigned child automatically earns the designated points.
A reward catalog can be created by parents, defining rewards and their point costs.
Children can view the available rewards and their point costs.
Children can initiate a request to 'purchase' a reward using their earned points.
Parents receive notifications for reward redemption requests.
Parents can approve or deny reward redemption requests.

title: Kid-Friendly Interface for Task Management
description: As a child, I want an easy-to-understand and engaging interface to view my tasks and rewards, so that I am motivated to use the app.
acceptance_criteria: The child's interface is visually appealing and intuitive.
Navigation for viewing tasks and rewards is simple.
Clear visual cues indicate pending tasks, completed tasks, and earned points.
Animations or sounds provide positive feedback upon task completion or reward redemption.
Children can easily see their current point balance.

title: Basic Reporting for Parents
description: As a parent, I want to see a summary of my children's completed tasks and earned points, so that I can track their progress and effort.
acceptance_criteria: Parents can view a report summarizing completed tasks for each child.
The report includes the total points earned by each child over a selected period (e.g., week, month).
The report displays the number of tasks completed by each child.

title: Cross-Platform Availability
description: As a user (parent or child), I want to access the application on various devices (web, mobile), so that I can manage schedules and tasks conveniently from anywhere.
acceptance_criteria: The application is available as a web application.
The application is available as a native iOS application.
The application is available as a native Android application.
User experience is consistent across all supported platforms.

title: Event Categories and Color Coding
description: As a parent, I want to categorize events and assign colors to them, so that I can quickly identify different types of activities on the calendar.
acceptance_criteria: Pre-defined categories for events are available (e.g., Sports, Academics, Arts, Health, Play, Chores).
Parents can create custom categories.
Parents can assign a unique color to each category.
Events on the calendar are displayed with their assigned category color.

title: Flexible Task Assignment Options
description: As a parent, I want flexibility in assigning tasks, so that I can manage them according to my family's needs.
acceptance_criteria: A single task can be assigned to multiple children simultaneously.
Tasks can be set up to be completed by a specific child but checked off by any parent.
Tasks can be assigned without a specific recurrence, allowing for one-off assignments.

title: Push Notifications for Key Events
description: As a user, I want to receive timely notifications for important events and updates, so that I stay informed and don't miss anything.
acceptance_criteria: Parents receive push notifications for upcoming events.
Parents receive push notifications for task reminders.
Children receive push notifications when a new task is assigned to them.
Children receive push notifications when a reward redemption request is approved or denied.
Users can configure which notifications they receive.

title: 21-Day Habit Building Module
description: As a parent, I want a feature to help establish new routines or habits with my children, so that we can build positive daily practices.
acceptance_criteria: A dedicated '21-Day Challenge' section is available.
Parents can define a specific habit or routine to track (e.g., 'Morning Routine').
Users can track daily adherence to the habit for 21 consecutive days.
Visual progress is shown for the 21-day streak.
Optional bonus rewards can be configured for completing the 21-day challenge.

title: Visual Progress Tracking for Kids
description: As a child, I want to see my progress in a visual and motivating way beyond just points, so that I feel accomplished and encouraged.
acceptance_criteria: Progress bars are displayed for tasks that are in progress or for overall completion goals.
Virtual badges or achievements are awarded for reaching milestones or completing challenges.
A visual representation of the child's 'reward level' or standing is shown.

title: Customizable Child Interface Themes
description: As a child, I want to personalize my app experience, so that it feels more like my own and is more engaging.
acceptance_criteria: Children can choose from a selection of pre-defined avatars for their profile.
Children can select from a few different visual themes for their task and reward views.

title: Optional Schedule Sharing with External Contacts
description: As a parent, I want to be able to share specific events or schedules with others (e.g., grandparents, babysitters), so that they are informed about relevant family activities.
acceptance_criteria: Parents can generate a shareable link for specific events or a read-only view of a subset of the family calendar.
Sharing can be temporary (e.g., for a specific date range).
The shared view is read-only.

title: Tiered Subscription Model
description: As a user, I want to have options for subscription plans, so that I can choose the features that best suit my family's needs and budget.
acceptance_criteria: A free tier with basic functionality is available.
Premium subscription tiers offer enhanced features (e.g., unlimited children, advanced reporting, more customization).
Users can upgrade or downgrade their subscription.
Payment processing is secure and reliable.

title: Advanced Reporting and Analytics
description: As a parent, I want detailed insights into my children's activity and productivity, so that I can better understand their habits and needs.
acceptance_criteria: Reports show time spent on different activity categories.
Analytics track reward redemption patterns.
Reports visualize habit formation trends over time.
Data can be exported (e.g., CSV).

title: Family Goal Setting Feature
description: As a family, we want to set collective goals, so that we can work together towards shared achievements.
acceptance_criteria: Parents can define family-wide goals.
Goals can require contributions from multiple children.
Progress towards family goals is visually tracked.

title: Integration with Other Calendar Services
description: As a user, I want the option to sync with other popular calendar services, so that I can consolidate my digital planning.
acceptance_criteria: Integration with Outlook Calendar is available.
Potential future integrations with other task management or calendar tools are considered.

title: Advanced Chore Scheduling Logic
description: As a parent, I want more sophisticated options for scheduling chores, so that household tasks are managed efficiently and fairly.
acceptance_criteria: Chore rotation among siblings can be configured.
Chores can be assigned based on child availability or specific time blocks.

title: Health and Wellness Tracking Module
description: As a parent, I want to track important health-related information for my children, so that their well-being is managed effectively.
acceptance_criteria: Ability to log and track appointments (doctor, dentist, etc.).
Option to set medication reminders.
Feature to log physical activity or wellness-related data.
